thread.title: HIGH SCHOOL ROUNDUP: Coyle-Cassidy girls soccer wins shootout against Taunton
thread.title_full: HIGH SCHOOL ROUNDUP: Coyle-Cassidy girls soccer wins shootout against Taunton

author: Staff Reports
title: HIGH SCHOOL ROUNDUP: Coyle-Cassidy girls soccer wins shootout against Taunton
text: HIGH SCHOOL ROUNDUP: Coyle-Cassidy girls soccer wins shootout against Taunton Warriors improve to 4-10-1 The Taunton Daily Gazette, Taunton, MA By Staff Reports Posted Oct. 25, 2015 at 10:10 AM Updated at 10:17 AM Posted Oct. 25, 2015 at 10:10 AM Updated at 10:17 AM TAUNTON — It was deja vu all over again for the Taunton High girls soccer team on Saturday. For the second year in a row, the city championship between the Tigers and city rivals Coyle-Cassidy came down to penalty kicks. And for the second straight year, the Warriors came out on top. Erin Cantwell, Maddie Fong and Nicole Bostick each scored goals during the PKs to lift C-C to a 1-0 victory over Taunton at Taunton High School. “I am so proud of the girls,” Warriors head coach Leslie “Scottie” Hutchison said. “We played our best game of the season against a great opponent. With all the injuries we had this season, it was a great win for our seniors. We gave it our all tonight.” Sara Coffey was named MVP for C-C (4-10-1) after making eight saves. Abby Small was named the Tigers MVP of the game. Alana Vincent scored Taunton’s lone goal during penalty kicks. The game was scoreless during the 80 minute regulation time. Taunton goalie Kayla Wentworth preserved a scoreless tie by making two saves off of breakaways. The Tigers also hit the cross bar and post during regulation. Despite the loss, Taunton still picked up a point and remain four point from making the state tournament. The Tigers face King Philip Tuesday while the Warriors take on Fairhaven Monday. Pentucket 47 The Warriors (1-6) lost to non-league opponent Pentucket. C-C awaits the MIAA non-playoff league schedule next week. FIELD HOCKEY Somerset Berkley 1 Old Rochester 0 Sydney Lavoie scored the lone goal in the second half to lift the Raiders (11-4-1) to a win over Old Rochester. Caitlin Murphy collected the assist on the game winner. Alyssa Soares picked up the shutout win in net. SB is at New Bedford Tuesday. By Staff Reports The Taunton Daily Gazette, Taunton, MA By Staff Reports Posted Oct. 25, 2015 at 10:10 AM Updated at 10:17 AM
